bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
This bug is the same with Redhat bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1351826
With a new Tianocore UEFI image that enables PCCT table (so the PCC driver is loaded during boot). If the PPC communication channel cannot be found, the kernel will panic after that.
2 already accepted (and currently in linux-next) are required to fix this issue:
1./ ACPI / CPPC: Prevent cpc_desc_ptr points to the invalid data http://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/next/linux-next.git/commit/drivers/acpi/cppc_acpi.c?id=2324d15447a9db168b1f85e3feac635b1ff8edb8
2./ ACPI: CPPC: Return error if _CPC is invalid on a CPU http://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/next/linux-next.git/commit/drivers/acpi/cppc_acpi.c?id=8343c40d3de32ebfe8f48b043964e4ba0e7701f7
Thanks for the update Hoan. I am not granted the access to the bug entry, thus wonder if that is only dedicated to discuss RHEL kernel or including Fedora's.
Itaru, this bug is opened for Redhat only. We need the same fix for Fedora.
OK. Then we need to keep this entry open until the new f24 kernel is released.

So the 4.7.2-201 kernel is in updates-testing for F-24. Please test
"dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing kernel*"

4.7.2-201 does not seem to work with the latest F/W yet.

Thanks Hoan

> How could I request [1][2] into the stable branch ? > And which branch should I request ?
I'm not talking about Fedora kernels here, I'm talking about upstream kernels. The process is generally to cc: stable@kernel.org
A random example from the arm-kernel list is here: http://www.spinics.net/lists/arm-kernel/msg527775.html

If you want to request a patch be submitted to the kernel stable trees, please take a look at the instructions http://lxr.free-electrons.com/source/Documentation/stable_kernel_rules.txt#L38 . It's also good practice to Cc maintainers and patch authors (if it isn't yourself) when doing the stable request so they can speak up and indicate if there are any problems with backporting.

> I don't know if you could backport below patches to enable PCC and CPPC for > Mustang board ?
No! This bug is _NOT_ the place to request random back ports of kernel patch sets. This bug is CLOSED, the problem at hand is fixed.
The default boot mechanism for Fedora 24 is not ACPI it's DT. I'm not wasting a bunch of my time backporting random patch sets just because you want them. I don't have the time and I don't care that much. If they're in 4.8 they will come to Fedora 24 around the 4.8.2 time frame. Otherwise if you can do it via the stable branch request but as it's not a bug fix I doubt they'll be pulled.
